trans-unit.source: If given Zope’s default temporary storage definition will be replaced by the lines of this parameter. If set to “off” or “false”, no temporary storage definition will be created. trans-unit.source: Offset applied to the port numbers used for ZServer configurations. For example, if the http-server port is 8080 and the port-base is 1000, the HTTP server will listen on port 9080. This makes it easy to change the complete set of ports used by a Zope server process. Zope defaults to 0.

trans-unit.source: This recipe creates and configures a Zope instance in parts. (Despite its name it nowadays only works for Zope 4+.) It also installs a control script, which is like zopectl, in the bin/ directory. The name of the control script is the name of the part in buildout. By default various runtime and log information will be stored inside the var/ directory.

trans-unit.source: command is similar to the fg command, but it does not create a subprocess to start up Zope. This is useful for two use cases. First, the supervisor program, to supervise long running processes like a Zope, require the process not to fork away, so that supervisor can control it. Second, IDEs like WingIDE and PyCharm support debugging running processes from within. For this to work, the process should also not fork away.
trans-unit.target: команда аналогична команде fg,но она не создает подпроцесс для запуска Zope.Это полезно для двух случаев использования.Во-первых,программа супервизора,чтобы контролировать длительные процессы,такие как Zope,требует,чтобы процесс не вилкировался,чтобы супервизор мог управлять им.Во-вторых,IDE,такие как WingIDE и PyCharm,поддерживают отладку запущенных процессов изнутри.Чтобы это сработало,процесс также не должен вилкиваться.
